title: How to Make Tuna Fish Patties

steps.headline: Open the can of tuna and drain off the liquid.
steps.description: Transfer the tuna to a large bowl. Flake with a fork.

steps.headline: Grind the bread to make bread crumbs.
steps.description: You can easily do this in a food processor. Alternatively, you can use ready-made bread crumbs.

steps.headline: Chop the celery and onion.
steps.description: Make sure to chop them quite finely. You can do this by hand or in a food processor.

steps.headline: Add all the ingredients to a mixing bowl.
steps.description:
To the tuna, add the celery, onion, egg lemon juice and salt. Then decide which optional flavorings to include:
For herby tuna fish patties, add parsley, dill and garlic powder. For spicy tuna fish patties, add dijon mustard, tabasco and chopped green onions or chives. For creamy tuna fish patties (with a kick) add cream of mushroom soup and some Worcester sauce. Tuna patties are very versatile, so you can also experiment with your own combination of herbs, spices, vegetables and other flavorings!

steps.headline: Mix well.
steps.description: Use a fork to mix all of the ingredients together, until they achieve an even consistency.

steps.headline: Form the tuna mixture into 3 or 4 patties.
steps.description: Take about 1/4 of the patty mixture in your hands and roll it to form a ball, then use the palm of your hand to flatten it into a patty. Do the same with the remaining mixture, then place the patties on a baking tray lined with wax paper. If you have time, allow the patties to chill for an hour in the refrigerator. This helps them to hold their shape during cooking.

steps.headline: Heat a small amount of cooking oil in a nonstick skillet.
steps.description: Olive or sunflower oil will both work, although a little butter is great for adding flavor. For healthier patties, use a low-fat cooking spray.

steps.headline: Fry the patties in hot oil until golden brown.
steps.description: This should only take 3 to 4 minutes on each side.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve the tuna patties with a wedge of lemon, some tartar sauce or sprinkled with a bit of dill. You can also serve the patties on slider buns to make tuna burgers.

text:
Open the can of tuna and drain off the liquid. Transfer the tuna to a large bowl. Flake with a fork. Grind the bread to make bread crumbs. You can easily do this in a food processor. Alternatively, you can use ready-made bread crumbs. Chop the celery and onion. Make sure to chop them quite finely. You can do this by hand or in a food processor. Add all the ingredients to a mixing bowl. To the tuna, add the celery, onion, egg lemon juice and salt. Then decide which optional flavorings to include:
For herby tuna fish patties, add parsley, dill and garlic powder. For spicy tuna fish patties, add dijon mustard, tabasco and chopped green onions or chives. For creamy tuna fish patties (with a kick) add cream of mushroom soup and some Worcester sauce. Tuna patties are very versatile, so you can also experiment with your own combination of herbs, spices, vegetables and other flavorings! Mix well. Use a fork to mix all of the ingredients together, until they achieve an even consistency. Form the tuna mixture into 3 or 4 patties. Take about 1/4 of the patty mixture in your hands and roll it to form a ball, then use the palm of your hand to flatten it into a patty. Do the same with the remaining mixture, then place the patties on a baking tray lined with wax paper. If you have time, allow the patties to chill for an hour in the refrigerator. This helps them to hold their shape during cooking. Heat a small amount of cooking oil in a nonstick skillet. Olive or sunflower oil will both work, although a little butter is great for adding flavor. For healthier patties, use a low-fat cooking spray. Fry the patties in hot oil until golden brown. This should only take 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Serve. Serve the tuna patties with a wedge of lemon, some tartar sauce or sprinkled with a bit of dill. You can also serve the patties on slider buns to make tuna burgers.
